conclusion: For a rod of length L moving with speed v in a uniform magnetic field B (field perpendicular to the plane of the loop), the induced emf is E = B L v
With loop resistance R, the current is I = E / R = (B L v)/R
Therefore the current is directly proportional to the speed.

premise: I is proportional to v and v₁ : v₂ = 1 : 2

conclusion: Power supplied by the external force
To maintain uniform motion, the external force must balance the magnetic force on the rod.

premise: Magnetic force magnitude: F = I L B
conclusion: The power delivered by the external force: P = F v = (I L B) v

premise: P = (I L B) v and I = B L v / R
conclusion: P = (B L v / R) (L B) v = (B² L² / R) v²
Thus the power is proportional to v².

premise: P is proportional to v² and v₁ : v₂ = 1 : 2

conclusion: Ratio of loop currents I₁ : I₂ = 1 : 2 and Ratio of external powers P₁ : P₂ = 1 : 4
